events.title: Tohoku Earthquake and Tsunami
events.description: A massive 9.0 magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of Japan, triggering a devastating tsunami that caused widespread destruction and led to the Fukushima nuclear disaster.
events.significance: One of the most powerful earthquakes ever recorded, causing significant loss of life and leading to major nuclear and environmental crises.

events.title: Lithuania Declares Independence from the Soviet Union
events.description: Lithuania became the first Soviet republic to declare independence, marking a significant step toward the dissolution of the USSR.
events.significance: This act inspired other republics and contributed to the eventual collapse of Soviet control in Eastern Europe.

events.title: Roots Miniseries Premieres
events.description: The groundbreaking television miniseries 'Roots' premiered in the United States, depicting the history of an African American family from slavery to freedom.
events.significance: It raised awareness about slavery and African American history, influencing American culture and television storytelling.

events.title: Queen Anne Ascends to the British Throne
events.description: Following the death of William III, Anne became Queen of England, Scotland, and Ireland, later the first monarch of Great Britain after the 1707 Union.
events.significance: Her reign saw the unification of England and Scotland and significant political developments.
